description: ICT Concept Relationship Graph v2 - Comprehensive coverage of all ICT trading concepts with full relationship mapping

ipda.name: Interbank Price Delivery Algorithm (IPDA)
ipda.description: The algorithm that delivers price between liquidity pools. Central thesis of ICT methodology.

liquidity.name: Liquidity
liquidity.description: The foundation of ICT - all price movement seeks liquidity. Resting orders at key levels.

smart_money.name: Smart Money
smart_money.description: Institutional traders, banks, and market makers who move price with large orders.

bsl.name: Buy-Side Liquidity (BSL)
bsl.description: Stop orders resting above swing highs, equal highs, and range highs. Targeted by sell programs.

ssl.name: Sell-Side Liquidity (SSL)
ssl.description: Stop orders resting below swing lows, equal lows, and range lows. Targeted by buy programs.

equal_highs.name: Equal Highs
equal_highs.description: Double/triple tops at approximately same level - NOT resistance, but liquidity pool that will be swept.

equal_lows.name: Equal Lows
equal_lows.description: Double/triple bottoms at approximately same level - NOT support, but liquidity pool that will be swept.

trendline_liquidity.name: Trendline Liquidity
trendline_liquidity.description: Stop orders clustered along trendlines where retail traders place stops. Often swept before reversal.

liquidity_sweep.name: Liquidity Sweep
liquidity_sweep.description: Price taking out a liquidity pool then reversing. Fluid process that is destined, not violent.

stop_hunt.name: Stop Hunt
stop_hunt.description: Deliberate triggering of retail stop orders by institutional players to fill large orders at better prices.

displacement.name: Displacement
displacement.description: Strong impulsive candle (2x+ average range) showing institutional commitment. Creates FVGs and validates OBs.

expansion.name: Expansion
expansion.description: Directional move out of consolidation/range. The distribution phase of AMD.

retracement.name: Retracement
retracement.description: Pullback within a trend to a PD array before continuation. Where entries occur.

reversal.name: Reversal
reversal.description: Change of trend direction confirmed by MSS/CHoCH after liquidity sweep.

consolidation.name: Consolidation
consolidation.description: Sideways price action building liquidity on both sides. The accumulation phase of AMD.

market_structure.name: Market Structure
market_structure.description: Higher highs/higher lows (bullish) or lower highs/lower lows (bearish) pattern.

bos.name: Break of Structure (BOS)
bos.description: Price closes beyond previous swing point in direction of trend. Continuation signal.

choch.name: Change of Character (CHoCH)
choch.description: First break of structure against prevailing trend. Early reversal warning, not entry signal alone.

sms.name: Shift in Market Structure (SMS/MSS)
sms.description: Confirmed reversal - break against trend with displacement. Stronger than CHoCH.

swing_high.name: Swing High
swing_high.description: Local price peak with lower highs on both sides. Potential resistance / BSL target.

swing_low.name: Swing Low
swing_low.description: Local price trough with higher lows on both sides. Potential support / SSL target.

swing_failure_pattern.name: Swing Failure Pattern (SFP)
swing_failure_pattern.description: Price sweeps beyond a swing point but fails to close beyond it. Strong reversal signal.

dealing_range.name: Dealing Range
dealing_range.description: The current range price is delivering within, defined by recent swing high and swing low.

cisd.name: Change in State of Delivery (CISD)
cisd.description: The candle that changes price delivery from seeking BSL to SSL or vice versa. Marks the shift point.

terminus.name: Terminus
terminus.description: Final objective of market maker model - PREDETERMINED before price reaches it. Located at discount (buys) or premium (sells) PD arrays.

fvg.name: Fair Value Gap (FVG)
fvg.description: 3-candle pattern with gap between candle 1 and candle 3 wicks. Algorithm returns to fill THE VOID. Higher priority than OB.

bisi.name: Buy Side Imbalance, Sell Side Inefficiency (BISI)
bisi.description: Bullish FVG - gap created by strong upward displacement. Price returns to this area as support.

sibi.name: Sell Side Imbalance, Buy Side Inefficiency (SIBI)
sibi.description: Bearish FVG - gap created by strong downward displacement. Price returns to this area as resistance.

inverse_fvg.name: Inverse Fair Value Gap
inverse_fvg.description: A mitigated FVG that flips role - bullish FVG becomes resistance after being traded through, and vice versa.

order_block.name: Order Block (OB)
order_block.description: Last opposing candle before displacement. Bullish OB = last down candle before up displacement. Entry at 50% of OB.

breaker_block.name: Breaker Block
breaker_block.description: Failed order block that trapped traders. OB that was traded through, creating a new level of support/resistance.

mitigation_block.name: Mitigation Block
mitigation_block.description: Zone where prior losing orders need to be closed out. Forms after balanced price range interaction.

propulsion_block.name: Propulsion Block
propulsion_block.description: Order block that contains a FVG within it, launching price with extra momentum. Price re-enters the FVG inside the OB.

rejection_block.name: Rejection Block
rejection_block.description: Candle with long wick showing rejection at a key level. The wick range becomes a potential reaction zone on revisit.

reclaimed_order_block.name: Reclaimed Order Block
reclaimed_order_block.description: An OB that was broken (became breaker) but then reclaimed when price reversed back. Can act as support/resistance again.

volume_imbalance.name: Volume Imbalance
volume_imbalance.description: Gap between consecutive candle BODIES (not wicks). Smaller than FVG. Price often returns to fill this gap.

liquidity_void.name: Liquidity Void
liquidity_void.description: Large gap in price where no trading occurred. Price moved so fast there is no opposing liquidity. Must be filled eventually.

balanced_price_range.name: Balanced Price Range (BPR)
balanced_price_range.description: When a BISI and SIBI overlap in price. The overlapping zone is extremely significant - ultra-high probability reaction zone.

premium_discount.name: Premium/Discount Zones
premium_discount.description: Price above equilibrium (50%) = premium (sell zone). Price below = discount (buy zone).

premium_array.name: Premium PD Array
premium_array.description: PD arrays in premium zone: bearish OB, bearish FVG (SIBI), bearish breaker. Sell from these in bearish bias.

discount_array.name: Discount PD Array
discount_array.description: PD arrays in discount zone: bullish OB, bullish FVG (BISI), bullish breaker. Buy from these in bullish bias.

equilibrium.name: Equilibrium (EQ)
equilibrium.description: 50% level of any range. Divides premium from discount. Price often reacts to EQ.

fair_value.name: Fair Value
fair_value.description: The price where the algorithm considers value is balanced. FVGs exist because price left fair value too quickly.

ote.name: Optimal Trade Entry (OTE)
ote.description: 61.8% to 79% Fibonacci retracement zone. Sweet spot at 70.5%. Best entry when aligned with FVG/OB.

ce.name: Consequent Encroachment (CE)
ce.description: 50% midpoint of a FVG. Price often reacts precisely at CE. Also applies to 50% of wicks, ranges, and candle bodies.

mean_threshold.name: Mean Threshold
mean_threshold.description: 50% level of an order block body. Key reaction level within the OB. Similar concept to CE but for order blocks.

irl.name: Internal Range Liquidity (IRL)
irl.description: Liquidity INSIDE the current dealing range: FVGs, order blocks, liquidity voids. Where entries happen.

erl.name: External Range Liquidity (ERL)
erl.description: Liquidity OUTSIDE the current dealing range: old swing highs/lows, equal highs/lows. Where targets reside.

draw_on_liquidity.name: Draw on Liquidity (DOL)
draw_on_liquidity.description: The liquidity pool price is currently being delivered towards. Determines bias and target. Always trade towards DOL.

daily_bias.name: Daily Bias
daily_bias.description: Pre-session determination of buy/sell direction based on HTF structure, DOL, and previous day's delivery.

killzone.name: Killzones
killzone.description: High-probability trading windows when institutional activity is highest. London (2-5 AM), NY AM (7-10 AM), NY PM (1:30-4 PM ET).

london_killzone.name: London Killzone
london_killzone.description: 2:00 AM - 5:00 AM ET. First real move of the day. Breaks Asia range. Look for Judas swing setups.

ny_am_killzone.name: NY AM Killzone
ny_am_killzone.description: 7:00 AM - 10:00 AM ET. Highest volume session. Primary trading window. Silver Bullet at 10-11 AM.

ny_pm_killzone.name: NY PM Killzone
ny_pm_killzone.description: 1:30 PM - 4:00 PM ET. Second push or reversal of AM move. PM Silver Bullet at 2-3 PM.

london_close_killzone.name: London Close Killzone
london_close_killzone.description: 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM ET. Often reverses the London/NY AM move. Profit-taking window.

asia_session.name: Asian Session
asia_session.description: 8:00 PM - 12:00 AM ET. Sets the range for the day. Generally accumulation. Mark levels, don't trade breakouts.

macro_time.name: Macro Times
macro_time.description: 20-minute algorithmic windows: :50 to :10 of each hour. 9:50, 10:10, 10:50, 11:10 etc. Displacement/FVG occur here.

cbdr.name: Central Bank Dealers Range (CBDR)
cbdr.description: 2:00 PM - 8:00 PM ET. Track range BEFORE session. Tight CBDR (<40 pips) signals coming expansion.

asia_range.name: Asian Range
asia_range.description: 8:00 PM - 12:00 AM ET range. More important than CBDR. SD levels set from Asia range predict London/NY expansion.

standard_deviation.name: Standard Deviation (SD)
standard_deviation.description: Projected expansion from CBDR/Asia range. +/-1 SD, +/-2 SD, +/-2.5 SD levels. Targets for expansion moves.

adr.name: Average Daily Range (ADR)
adr.description: Average pip range of the daily candle over 5/10/20 days. Used to project daily expansion targets.

midnight_open.name: Midnight Open
midnight_open.description: Price at midnight New York time. Key reference level. Often acts as equilibrium for the day.

true_day.name: True Day
true_day.description: ICT's true trading day runs midnight to midnight ET, not the broker's server day.

optimal_trade_days.name: Optimal Trade Days
optimal_trade_days.description: Tuesday and Wednesday are highest probability. Monday/Thursday good. Avoid Friday afternoon.

silver_bullet.name: Silver Bullet
silver_bullet.description: Precision time-based setup. AM: 10-11 AM ET. PM: 2-3 PM ET. London: 3-4 AM ET. FVG in direction of bias during window.

am_silver_bullet.name: AM Silver Bullet
am_silver_bullet.description: 10:00-11:00 AM ET. Most reliable Silver Bullet window. FVG in bias direction during this hour. Target 15-20 pips.

pm_silver_bullet.name: PM Silver Bullet
pm_silver_bullet.description: 2:00-3:00 PM ET. Second Silver Bullet window. Often reverses AM direction or continues for final push.

london_silver_bullet.name: London Silver Bullet
london_silver_bullet.description: 3:00-4:00 AM ET. London session Silver Bullet. FVG during this window with HTF bias alignment.

judas_swing.name: Judas Swing
judas_swing.description: False move opposite to true direction at session open. 100% time-based. Traps counter-trend traders, grabs liquidity.

power_of_three.name: Power of Three (AMD)
power_of_three.description: Accumulation-Manipulation-Distribution. Core ICT framework. Applies to sessions, days, weeks, and individual candles.

po3_candle.name: Power of Three on Candle
po3_candle.description: Each candle is AMD: Open = accumulation, wick = manipulation, body = distribution. Bullish: open, low, high, close.

turtle_soup.name: Turtle Soup
turtle_soup.description: Liquidity sweep of clean highs/lows with immediate reversal. Speed of reversal = quality of signal.

ict_2022_model.name: ICT 2022 Model
ict_2022_model.description: Full AMD cycle trade. Accumulation range + manipulation sweep + displacement FVG entry. Best at session opens.

mmbm.name: Market Maker Buy Model (MMBM)
mmbm.description: Full bullish reversal roadmap. Smart money accumulates at lows, sweeps SSL, displacement up, targets BSL. Scaled AMD.

mmsm.name: Market Maker Sell Model (MMSM)
mmsm.description: Full bearish reversal roadmap. Smart money distributes at highs, sweeps BSL, displacement down, targets SSL. Scaled AMD.

unicorn.name: Unicorn Setup
unicorn.description: Breaker block + FVG confluence. Highest probability setup. Rare (2-3 per week). Enter inside FVG portion.

london_close_model.name: London Close Model
london_close_model.description: Fade the London/NY AM move during 10 AM-12 PM ET. Price often retraces to London open price. Partial profit-taking model.

ict_stinger.name: ICT Stinger
ict_stinger.description: RSI/Stochastic divergence at OTE retracement level. Oscillator divergence + 62-79% fib = high probability reversal.

iofed.name: Institutional Order Flow Entry Drill (IOFED)
iofed.description: LTF pattern: displacement candle creates FVG, price retraces to FVG, then continues. Drill down from HTF to 1M for precision entry.

smt_divergence.name: SMT Divergence
smt_divergence.description: Smart Money Technique. Correlated pair makes new high/low, other doesn't. The non-confirming pair shows true direction.

ipda_data_ranges.name: IPDA Data Ranges
ipda_data_ranges.description: 20-day, 40-day, and 60-day lookback ranges the IPDA uses. Price seeks PD arrays from these ranges for draw on liquidity.

buy_program.name: Buy Program
buy_program.description: Institutional buying phase. Price seeks discount PD arrays, sweeps SSL, displaces upward targeting BSL.

sell_program.name: Sell Program
sell_program.description: Institutional selling phase. Price seeks premium PD arrays, sweeps BSL, displaces downward targeting SSL.

algorithmic_pairing.name: Algorithmic Order Pairing
algorithmic_pairing.description: The IPDA pairs buy orders with sell orders. Every buyer needs a seller. Liquidity pools are where pairing occurs.

market_efficiency_paradigm.name: Market Efficiency Paradigm
market_efficiency_paradigm.description: Price must deliver efficiently between PD arrays. FVGs must be filled, liquidity must be taken. Nothing is wasted.

delivery.name: Price Delivery
delivery.description: How the IPDA delivers price from one PD array to another. IRL to ERL, discount to premium, and back.

narrative.name: Narrative
narrative.description: The story price action tells about smart money intent. Why here, why now, what would kill it. Required for every trade.

time_price_theory.name: Time and Price Theory
time_price_theory.description: Time is more important than price. The right setup at the wrong time is wrong. Killzones, macro times, and session timing are primary.

nwog.name: New Week Opening Gap (NWOG)
nwog.description: Gap between Friday's close and Sunday's open. Often acts as magnet/equilibrium for the week. Price returns to fill it.

ndog.name: New Day Opening Gap (NDOG)
ndog.description: Gap between yesterday's close and today's open. Acts as equilibrium reference for the day.

nmog.name: New Month Opening Gap (NMOG)
nmog.description: Gap between prior month's close and new month's open. HTF reference point for monthly bias.

sunday_open_gap.name: Sunday Open Gap
sunday_open_gap.description: Gap at Sunday market open. Often filled during early week price action. Related to NWOG.

pdh_pdl.name: Previous Day High/Low (PDH/PDL)
pdh_pdl.description: Prior day's high and low. Key liquidity levels. Sweep of PDH targets BSL, sweep of PDL targets SSL.

pwh_pwl.name: Previous Week High/Low (PWH/PWL)
pwh_pwl.description: Prior week's high and low. HTF liquidity targets. Often the draw on liquidity for the current week.

pmh_pml.name: Previous Month High/Low (PMH/PML)
pmh_pml.description: Prior month's high and low. Major HTF liquidity pools. Monthly bias determined by which side is targeted.

old_high.name: Old High
old_high.description: Previous swing high on HTF. Buy-side liquidity target. Price is drawn to old highs.

old_low.name: Old Low
old_low.description: Previous swing low on HTF. Sell-side liquidity target. Price is drawn to old lows.

weekly_profile.name: Weekly Profile
weekly_profile.description: How the trading week typically unfolds. Monday: range/accumulation. Tue/Wed: real moves. Thu: continuation/reversal. Fri: profit-taking.

monthly_profile.name: Monthly Profile
monthly_profile.description: How the trading month typically unfolds. First week establishes range, mid-month real move, last week distribution.

quarterly_theory.name: Quarterly Theory
quarterly_theory.description: ICT quarterly shifts. Markets shift direction at quarter boundaries. Q1 (Jan-Mar), Q2 (Apr-Jun), Q3 (Jul-Sep), Q4 (Oct-Dec).

seasonal_tendencies.name: Seasonal Tendencies
seasonal_tendencies.description: Seasonal patterns in markets. Dollar typically weakens in Jan, strengthens in Q3. Gold rallies in Q1. Know the tendencies.

candle_theory.name: ICT Candle Theory
candle_theory.description: Monthly candle predicts weekly, weekly predicts daily. Each candle follows PO3: open, extreme (manipulation), body (distribution).

dxy_correlation.name: DXY Correlation
dxy_correlation.description: US Dollar Index inversely correlates with EUR/USD, GBP/USD. DXY up = USD pairs down. Critical for forex bias.

bond_yield_correlation.name: Bond Yield Correlation
bond_yield_correlation.description: US Treasury yields correlate with USD/JPY and USD strength. Rising yields = stronger dollar generally.

intermarket_analysis.name: Intermarket Analysis
intermarket_analysis.description: Cross-market relationships: DXY, bonds, equities, commodities. Divergences between correlated assets signal reversals.

risk_on_risk_off.name: Risk-On / Risk-Off
risk_on_risk_off.description: Risk-on: equities up, yields up, CHF/JPY weak. Risk-off: equities down, yields down, CHF/JPY strong. Affects pair selection.

institutional_sponsorship.name: Institutional Sponsorship
institutional_sponsorship.description: Presence of institutional orders behind a move. Confirmed by displacement, volume, and follow-through. No sponsorship = no trade.

order_flow.name: Order Flow
order_flow.description: The footprint of institutional buying/selling. Visible through displacement, FVGs, and candle structure on LTF.

accumulation.name: Accumulation
accumulation.description: Smart money building positions in a range. Equal highs/lows form. Wait, don't enter yet. Part of AMD cycle.

manipulation.name: Manipulation
manipulation.description: False move to grab liquidity (Judas swing). Sweeps stop orders. The entry signal - manipulation IS the setup.

distribution.name: Distribution
distribution.description: Real move delivering to target. Displacement + FVG + continuation. Enter on retracement during distribution.

re_accumulation.name: Re-Accumulation
re_accumulation.description: Continuation pattern within an uptrend. Pause/consolidation before another expansion leg. Builds more liquidity.

re_distribution.name: Re-Distribution
re_distribution.description: Continuation pattern within a downtrend. Pause/consolidation before another leg down. Builds more liquidity.

wyckoff_accumulation.name: Wyckoff Accumulation
wyckoff_accumulation.description: ICT-adapted Wyckoff: PS-SC-AR-ST-Spring-SOS-LPS-BU. Spring = liquidity sweep (SSL). SOS = displacement.

wyckoff_distribution.name: Wyckoff Distribution
wyckoff_distribution.description: ICT-adapted Wyckoff: PSY-BC-AR-ST-UTAD-SOW-LPSY. UTAD = liquidity sweep (BSL). SOW = displacement down.

market_maker_profile.name: Market Maker Profile
market_maker_profile.description: How market makers operate intraday: accumulate in Asia, manipulate at London open, distribute in NY. The daily PO3.

htf_bias.name: Higher Timeframe Bias
htf_bias.description: Direction determined by Daily/4H structure. NEVER trade against HTF bias. LTF must promote HTF.

mtf_bridge.name: MTF Bridge (1H/15M)
mtf_bridge.description: 1H/15M timeframes bridge HTF bias to LTF execution. Refine HTF zones into tradeable areas.

ltf_execution.name: LTF Execution (5M/1M)
ltf_execution.description: 5M/1M timeframes for precise entry timing. Only execute when MTF/HTF aligned. Micro structure confirmation.

cbdr_asia_sd_model.name: CBDR/Asia SD Model
cbdr_asia_sd_model.description: Ashton's signature model. Tight CBDR + Asia SD confluence + terminus identified = entry at Asia SD zone.

edges.description: IPDA's primary directive is to seek and pair liquidity
IPDA controls how price is delivered
IPDA executes order pairing at liquidity pools
IPDA enforces market efficiency - FVGs must fill
IPDA data ranges identify the draw on liquidity
BSL is a type of liquidity
SSL is a type of liquidity
Trendline liquidity is stops along trendlines
BSL found above previous day high
BSL found above previous week high
BSL found above previous month high
SSL found below previous day low
SSL found below previous week low
SSL found below previous month low
Valid sweeps are followed by displacement
IRL includes FVGs within the range
IRL includes order blocks within the range
ERL includes equal highs outside range
ERL includes equal lows outside range
Displacement is a strong form of expansion
BOS is a type of structure event
SMS is a type of structure event
CHoCH is a type of structure event
CHoCH is early warning before confirmed SMS
SFP is a form of failed liquidity sweep
Large FVGs overlap with liquidity voids
Mean threshold is 50% of OB body
OB with FVG inside = Propulsion Block
Volume imbalance often appears near OBs
Rejection block is a variation of OB concept
Mitigation blocks close out prior losing positions
Premium zone contains premium PD arrays
Discount zone contains discount PD arrays
Fair value concept explains why FVGs get filled
Fair value and equilibrium are related concepts
Price delivery uses IRL for entries
NY AM KZ is a killzone
NY PM KZ is a killzone
NY AM contains AM Silver Bullet window
NY PM contains PM Silver Bullet window
London KZ contains London Silver Bullet
London close KZ enables the London close model
Asian session defines the Asia range
Asia range projects SD levels for London/NY
True day starts at midnight open
Midnight open is reference for daily bias
Time theory determines best trade days
NWOG is reference for weekly profile
NDOG is reference for daily bias
Sunday gap is related to NWOG
AM Silver Bullet is a type
PM Silver Bullet is a type
London Silver Bullet is a type
AMD applies to individual candle structure
AMD scales to Market Maker Buy Model
AMD scales to Market Maker Sell Model
ICT 2022 model based on AMD framework
Stinger pattern aligns with OTE zone
Stinger uses oscillator divergence like SMT uses pair divergence
IOFED drills into LTF FVG for entry
London close model trades the reversal
SMT is a form of intermarket analysis
Smart money creates visible order flow
Accumulation repeats as re-accumulation in uptrend
Distribution repeats as re-distribution in downtrend
Wyckoff UTAD = ICT liquidity sweep of BSL
HTF bias uses DOL for direction
Candle theory based on PO3 candle concept
Quarterly shifts relate to seasonal tendencies
Weekly profile determines optimal trade days
Monthly profile nests within quarterly theory
Retracement measured by OTE fib levels
Consolidation seen as accumulation in ICT

beginner.description: Foundation concepts - learn in this order

intermediate.description: Build on foundations with structure and entries

advanced.description: Master setups, PD arrays, and timing
